intro: Glycosmis arborea var. insularis, commonly known as the Island Mimusops, is a small evergreen tree native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically yellow when ripe, containing a single seed. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in lowland forests and coastal areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
